INTSEL1N2.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL1N2 should be used.

INTSEL3N4.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL3N4 should be used.

SOCPRICTL.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCSOCPRICTL should be used.

COMPHYSTCTL.msg: This functionality has been moved to the Comparator Subsystem.
COMPHYSTCTL.fixMsg: The correct register Cmpss1Regs.COMPHYSCTL should be used. See the Comparator Subsystem (CMPSS) Registers Section of the TRM for more information.

ADCCTL1.TEMPCONV.msg: This functionality has been moved to the Analog Subsystem.
ADCCTL1.TEMPCONV.fixMsg: The correct bitfield AnalogSubsysRegs.TSNSCTL.bit.ENABLE should be used. See the Analog Subsystem Registers Section of the TRM for more information.

ADCCTL1.ADCREFSEL.msg: This functionality has been moved to the Analog Subsystem.
ADCCTL1.ADCREFSEL.fixMsg: The correct bitfield AnalogSubsysRegs.ANAREFCTL.bit.ANAREFSEL should be used. See the Analog Subsystem Registers Section of the TRM for more information.

ADCCTL1.ADCPWDN.fixMsg: The correct bit ADCCTL1.bit.ADCPWDNZ should be used.

ADCCTL2.CLKDIV2EN.fixMsg: The correct bit ADCCTL2.bit.PRESCALE should be used.

INTSEL1N2.INT1SEL.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL1N2.bit.INT1SEL should be used.

INTSEL1N2.INT1E.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL1N2.bit.INT1E should be used.

INTSEL1N2.INT2CONT.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL1N2.bit.INT2CONT should be used.

INTSEL3N4.INT4E.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL3N4.bit.INT4E should be used.

INTSEL3N4.INT4CONT.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCINTSEL3N4.bit.INT4CONT should be used.

SOCPRICTL.SOCPRIORITY.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCSOCPRICTL.bit.SOCPRIORITY should be used.

SOCPRICTL.RRPOINTER.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCSOCPRICTL.bit.RRPOINTER should be used.

SOCPRICTL.ONESHOT.fixMsg: The correct bitfield ADCBURSTCTL.bit.BURSTEN should be used.

COMPHYSTCTL.COMP1_HYST_DISABLE.msg: This functionality has been moved to the Comparator Subsystem.
COMPHYSTCTL.COMP1_HYST_DISABLE.fixMsg: The correct bitfield Cmpss1Regs.COMPHYSCTL.bit.COMPHYS should be used. NOTE: There is only 1 Comparator Subsystem in f280013x. See the Comparator Subsystem (CMPSS) Section of the TRM for more information.

TBPHS.msg: This register has expanded in size in order to include the High Resolution (HR) functionality of PWM.
TBPHS.fixMsg: The correct bit TBPHS.bit.TBPHS should be used.

CMPA.msg: This register has expanded in size in order to include the High Resolution (HR) functionality of PWM.
CMPA.fixMsg: The correct bit CMPA.bit.CMPA should be used.

CMPB.msg: This register has expanded in size in order to include the High Resolution (HR) functionality of PWM.
CMPB.fixMsg: The correct bit CMPB.bit.CMPB should be used.

TBCTL.SYNCOSEL.msg: This functionality has moved to EPWMSYNCOUTEN register.
TBCTL.SYNCOSEL.fixMsg: The correct bit in EPWMSYNCOUTEN register should be used based on your design. See the EPWMSYNCOUTEN Register Description in the TRM for more options and information.

HRPWR.MEPOFF.msg: This functionality has moved to CALPWRON bitfield.
HRPWR.MEPOFF.fixMsg: The correct bit HRPWR.bit.CALPWRON should be used. NOTE: Logic of this bitfield functionally has changed. See the HRPWR Register Description in the TRM for more information

TBPRDM.fixMsg: The correct bit TBPRD should be used. By default, the shadow register is automatically written to through TBPRD. See the TBPRD Register Description in the TRM for more information.

CMPAM.fixMsg: The correct bit CMPA should be used. By default, the shadow register is automatically written to through CMPA. See the CMPA Register Description in the TRM for more information.

I2CEMDR.BCM.fixMsg: The correct bitfield I2CEMDR.bit.BC should be used.

SCIRXBUF.RXDT.fixMsg: The correct bitfield SCIRXBUF.bit.SAR should be used.

SCIFFTX.TXFIFOXRESET.fixMsg: The correct bitfield SCIFFTX.bit.TXFIFORESET should be used.

SCIPRI.FREE.fixMsg: The correct bitfield SCIPRI.bit.FREESOFT should be used. See Serial Communications Interface (SCI) Priority Control Section in TRM for more information.

SCIPRI.SOFT.fixMsg: The correct bitfield SCIPRI.bit.FREESOFT should be used. See Serial Communications Interface (SCI) Priority Control Section in TRM for more information.
